pros: amazing mission supporting patients and family
cons: high pace, multiple operational changes

pros: great mission based organization , great co workers and work life balance and great benefits and vacation time . love the ability to float to hospice as a therapist. no issue getting time off
cons: sometimes challenging patients as high level of end of life patients .

review_title: Meaningful work in a supportive environment
job_title: Chief Philanthropy Officer in Providence, RI
pros: I have worked in a number of nonprofit organizations during my 40+-year career, and HopeHealth is the best run, most responsive and supportive of them all. The health care industry is very competitive in this country and HopeHealth manages to navigate constant change while always keeping patients' needs foremost. My colleagues support my department's work and are true partners. Working with grieving families is probably not for everyone, but it is also extremely rewarding.
cons: Some may find being around illness, death and dying challenging.

pros: Coworkers are friendly and helpful. Family environment Management is invested in improvement of company processes
cons: The communication and work flow process is slow. Slow onboarding process

pros: Generous benefits and supportive management
cons: work/life balance not always attainable

review_title: Potential to be a great company
pros: The job and working with clients at hospice is an amazing and very rewarding experience.
cons: The company needs to listen to their employees more.

pros: None! Management is horrible! The company isn’t what they use to be
cons: Pay is low, management doesn’t listen

pros:
Coworkers are like family
Opportunities for continuing education
My manager was awesome and helpful
cons: Upper management should spend a day with front line staff to ensure best support

review_title: Good company if you’re a patient or family
job_title: RN Case Manager in Providence, RI
pros: Excellent benefit package. I enjoyed working with my patients and their families. Overall the company has potential to be excellent if they were more professional.
cons: CEO, Management for RN case managers, Human Resource, some employees, amongst others were very unprofessional. Company seemed welcoming at first but turned out to be a terrible place to work for. Not helpful at all, especially with new employees. Doesn’t take constructive criticism and complaints seriously. Too much drama leading to a very unpleasant and unprofessional workplace. Management and HR not helpful when coming to them with issues in the workplace. Complaints not taken seriously and ignored. Favoritism amongst employees.

pros:
The work we do makes a huge difference in people's lives--the patient and their family
I truly like everyone I work with
People in this organization care about doing a great job and always think about what we can do even better
The community feels strongly about the value of this organization
The organization's COVID response has been excellent: prepared (as one could be), thoughtful, clear (as one could be given the ever-changing guidelines), flexible
cons: The healthcare system in the US is fragmented and profit-driven, even in the hospice world. It's good to work for an organization that provides an excellent service and invests in its community with needed programs, like grief support.

pros:
-Decent Benefits
-flexible schedule
-decent pay
-you do not have to work every other weekend. 
-you do not have to work every other holidays
cons:
-no consistency 
-too many changes in short periods of time
-poor job morale
-high turn over
- no appreciation for long term employees

review_title: Hope Health is an organization with a strong mission and a dedicated team
pros:
Warm welcome from team members
General orientation gave a strong introduction into the mission and purpose Hope Health 
Direct training with manager has been extremely informative. My manager is a great mentor.
cons: No cons noted at this time

review_title: Great orientation and focus on training
pros: I've been in the health care business for about 25 years and I had the best orientation with comprehensive teaching. Also, it was great to meet the staff "behind the scenes". Very transparent management with focus on training and patient quality of care.
cons: I'm a new employee. No cons so far.

job_title: Admission Registered Nurse in Providence, RI
pros:
I recently started working for HopeHealth & I am very impressed! It’s been very apparent that their main priority are the patients and their families. The amount of services they provide is amazing! HopeHealth does a great job at truly having a interdisciplinary team for each individual patient and their family and makes every effort to find out how they can provide the best individualized care.

Everyone that I have spoken to about the organization talks very highly about them. The employees that I had the pleasure to work alongside so far, also talk very highly about the company and are very happy to be working for them. I noticed that many of the employees have been apart of the organization for many years, which speaks volumes. Overall, I’m very excited to be a part of this organization!
cons: I don’t have any currently! All positive things!

pros: engagement, I'm not sure what else
cons: job responsibility overload, favoritism, changes without notice

pros:
Great work/life balance
Supported from all areas of the organization
Encourage growth from within
Open to ideas
Great patient care
cons: A lot of turnover in staff leads to lack of consistency.

pros:
Autonomy
Good benefits
Hospice work is very rewarding
cons: Pay is not competitive. Salary increases barely keep up with cost of living.

pros: The entire process from the initial communication to the first week of orientation was a very pleasant experience and staff maintained transparency about expectations.
cons: The only con I would mention would be that once the employee is set-up to begin orientation that they could supply the pending schedule for the first few weeks before the second day of orientation.

job_title: Home Health RN Case Manager in Lincoln, RI
pros: Positive and caring work environment, knowledgeable staff, team work oriented, responsive support system when in the field, generous benefits, and a positive work/life balance.
cons: More staff is needed now

review_title: Not all cracked up to be
job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) in Lincoln, RI
pros:
Helping people in their homes 
Can have meaningful connections with patients.
Truly a hands on healing
1:1
cons: Not enough work for LPN. Forgot about during training. Literally would have days no one in office would return my calls, no assignments = no pay wouldn’t know until day of

pros: The focus is on providing excellent care to patients as opposed to how much money you can make the organization. HH also has a focus on taking care of employees. Healthcare is a demanding professional field, but there seems to be a real focus on taking care of employees as well as patients.
cons: Most clinical positions involve travel

pros: approachable managers, admirable company mission, clear recruitment and interview processes.
cons: I can't think of any cons at this time

pros: Friendly, Informative, Innovative, Inclusive and Caring
cons: I do not have any cons at this time

pros: The work is meaningful and satisfying. Leadership has been very supportive through the pandemic
cons: Field staff have to travel to see patients, but most of the time in a limited area

pros: The company really believes in their mission. I have never met a more dedicated group of individuals, theres not one person i have come across that i can find anything negative to say about. The nurses and aides are excellent. The management is supportive and available. The clients and families are amazing, its a sad occupation but you get s chance to meet people who led amazing lives, hear there stories and know your helping provide peace and comfort to the families and patients.
cons: Not many, sometimes lately the patient load can be heavy but its usually temporary.

job_title: RN Case Manager in Warwick, RI
pros: Excellent team to work with, great benefits, able to do some amazing work out in our community.  Good IT resources as well.
cons: Always quite a bit of change and alterations to productivity, sometimes difficult to get good open communication to upper nursing management

job_title: Patient Care Manager in Providence, RI
pros: Excellent company to work for. Many growth opportunities for staff to grow from within the organization. Support and education offered to all employees to ensure staff well prepared in the field.  excellent benefits and time off offered to both part and full time staff. Leadership sensitive to the nature of the work and encourage a good work life balance as well as good self care
cons: If not caring for yourself, can lead to burnout

review_title: Nothing short of the best experience in 10+ yrs of hospice
pros: The company and management are invested in their employees, Clients and families.  There is alot of heart in this company. Great benefits and lots of support
cons: The same challenges that face the medical field,  too much paperwork not enough time to do it.  Not specific to HHCRI and the computers help alot

pros: There are none.  Just don't work there - it's not worth the stress.
cons: 2nd to worst job I've ever had-the first being a summer factory job I had while in high school.  That's just what this job was like - working in a factory, except you're in a different setting.  I was in an office.  My supervisor was a mean-spirited moron and her boss was totally inappropriate - loud, obnoxious, inappropriately dressed.  Just a horrible work environment.  The huge turnover should have clued me in.  Live and learn.

job_title: Patient Care Manager in Providence, RI
pros: I have worked here for 19 years and love my job. I have done many things in nursing here and have worked for several dept's. I have always looked forward to work and enjoyed the positive and supportive teams here at Hope Health.
cons: Hospice is always challenging and a lot of changes due to reimbursement changes

pros: Staff are awesome!  The teams are unbelievable.  They support each other and do a fabulous job taking care of their patients.  The organization invests in their staff.
cons: Every job has cons.  The pros and job satisfaction here outweigh all of them

pros: HopeHealth's mission to provide exceptional care to patients and their families makes it easy to feel good about the work you do every day.  There are amazing staff at HopeHealth that are wonderful to work with.
cons: HopeHealth is growing and has open jobs available.

job_title: Pediatric Program Manager in Brockton, MA
pros: Flexible schedule, a lot of versatility in my job.  Great support from senior management, and great place to work within a multi-disciplinary team.
cons: I wish the 401 K was a 3% match and the health benefits was a no deductible plan.

review_title: A great organization to work for
pros: The wages and benefit package was outstanding, and the management and fellow staff were very understanding and caring.
cons: Since Hospice cares for End-of-Life patients the subject of death and dying is always there

review_title: Great people to work with and wonderful mission!
pros: There is a culture of transparency, low on politics and very high in making a difference in the life of others.
cons: No significant cons noted compared to other places I have worked before.

pros: Open communication between all staff. Excellent benefits. Awesome colleagues who are compassionate about the company mission
cons: To be expected in health care. Hard to say no to working extra. Worrying about patients when you’re not working.

job_title: Clinical Support Supervisor in Lincoln, RI
pros: They value their employees and the work that they do.  Exceptional team of staff with supportive leadership.
cons: Keep recruiting !  We need to add more staff to our amazing team.

job_title: Director of Operations in Lincoln, RI
pros:
Supportive and transparent Clinical Management team
Clinical teams are patient focused and collaborative
cons: I have no cons for working at HopeHealth

job_title: Vice President of Philanthropy in Providence, RI
pros: Important, uplifting  work that helps people at a very difficult time in their lives.
cons: Can be emotional at times.
